content: प्रसादः {@--1@} Favour, kindness, condescension, propitiousness; कुरु दृष्टिप्रसादं ‘be pleased to show yourself’; इत्याप्रसादादस्यास्त्वं परिचर्यापरो भव <ls>R. 1. 91</ls>; <ls n="R.">2. 22.</ls> {@--2@} Good temper, graciousness of disposition. {@--3@} Calmness, tranquillity, composure, serenity, sedateness, absence of excitement; <ls>Bg. 2. 64.</ls> {@--4@} Clearness, limpidness, brightness, transparency, purity (as of water, mind &c.); गंगा रोधः पतनकलुषा गृह्णतीव प्रसादं <ls>V. 1. 8</ls>; <ls>Ś. 7. 32</ls>; प्राप्तबुद्धिप्रसादाः <ls>Śi. 11. 6</ls>; <ls>R. 17. 1</ls>; <ls>Ki. 9. 25.</ls> {@--5@} Perspicuity, clearness of style, one of the three Guṇas according to Mammaṭa, who thus defines it; शुष्केंधनाग्निबत् स्वच्छजलबत्सहसैव यः . व्याप्नोत्यन्यत्प्रसादोसौ सर्वत्र विहितस्थितिः <ls>K. P. 8</ls>; यावदर्थकपदत्वरूपमर्थवैमल्यं प्रसादः or श्रुतमात्रा वाक्यार्थं करतलबदरमिव निवेदयंती घटना प्रसादस्य <ls>R. G.</ls>; see <ls>Kāv. 1. 44</ls>; <ls>S. D. 611</ls> also. {@--6@} Food offered to idols &c., or the remnants of such food. {@--7@} A free gift, gratuity. {@--8@} Any propitiatory offering. {@--9@} Wellbeing, welfare.
